channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Norfolk Southern reaches a multi-million-dollar settlement over Ohio train derailment
item.description: Among other fees, they will pay $235 million for the Environmental Protection Agency's past and future clean-up for contaminated air, water, and soil in and around where the train derailed in 2023.
item.content:encoded:
Among other fees, they will pay $235 million for the Environmental Protection Agency's past and future clean-up for contaminated air, water, and soil in and around where the train derailed in 2023.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: A verbal spat between Reps. Crockett and Greene highlights racial and gender tensions
item.description: After Georgia Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene insulted the appearance of Rep. Jasmine Crockett, a controversial, viral moment was born.
item.content:encoded:
After Georgia Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene insulted the appearance of Rep. Jasmine Crockett, a controversial, viral moment was born.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Meeting the Gangs that Control Haiti
item.description: After a long decline of the government in Haiti, gangs have seized complete control. A multi-national force is being sent to Haiti to restore the government to power, but their success is not assured. We go to Port-au-Prince, Haiti to see the challenges this international mission will face.
item.content:encoded: After a long decline of the government in Haiti, gangs have seized complete control. A multi-national force is being sent to Haiti to restore the government to power, but their success is not assured. We go to Port-au-Prince, Haiti to see the challenges this international mission will face.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Some NFL fans see disparities in its responses to Harrison Butker and Colin Kaepernick
item.description: NFL head Roger Goodell, reacting to Harrison Butker's controversial commencement speech, said the league values diversity of opinion. Some fans were quick to argue that hasn't always seemed the case.
item.content:encoded: NFL head Roger Goodell, reacting to Harrison Butker's controversial commencement speech, said the league values diversity of opinion. Some fans were quick to argue that hasn't always seemed the case.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: The U.N.'s top court says it will rule Friday on Israel's offensive in Rafah
item.description: The U.N.'s top court is expected to issue an order Friday on Israel’s offensive in Rafah, potentially ordering Israel to halt the operation. The case was brought by South Africa.
item.content:encoded:
The U.N.'s top court is expected to issue an order Friday on Israel’s offensive in Rafah, potentially ordering Israel to halt the operation. The case was brought by South Africa.

(Image credit: Remko de Waal)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: How a colorful Malaysian businessman bilked the U.S. Navy for millions
item.description: In Fat Leonard, journalist Craig Whitlock tells the story of a defense contractor who plied Navy commanders with lavish meals, trips, cash and sex workers. In return they let him overcharge taxpayers.
item.content:encoded: In Fat Leonard, journalist Craig Whitlock tells the story of a defense contractor who plied Navy commanders with lavish meals, trips, cash and sex workers. In return they let him overcharge taxpayers.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: The Spring housing market is competitive; how cycling helps your joints
item.description: It's tough out there for home buyers. Here's what you can do to increase your changes of snagging a home. And, new research reveals cycling can help with knee pain and longevity.
item.content:encoded:
It's tough out there for home buyers. Here's what you can do to increase your changes of snagging a home. And, new research reveals cycling can help with knee pain and longevity.

(Image credit: Steven Senne)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Biden names Kenya a major non-NATO ally during state visit
item.description: It’s been more than 15 years since an African leader was granted a White House state visit. President Biden is trying to upgrade the U.S. relationship with Kenya.
item.content:encoded:
It’s been more than 15 years since an African leader was granted a White House state visit. President Biden is trying to upgrade the U.S. relationship with Kenya.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: A billionaire surprised graduates onstage with cash, but it's not all theirs to keep
item.description: Billionaire philanthropist Rob Hale gave UMass Dartmouth graduates $1,000 each, and instructed them to donate half. He tells NPR the best cause students can support is one that matters to them.
item.content:encoded:
Billionaire philanthropist Rob Hale gave UMass Dartmouth graduates $1,000 each, and instructed them to donate half. He tells NPR the best cause students can support is one that matters to them.

(Image credit: Karl Christoff Dominey)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: At least 4 people have died and 35 are injured in a tornado that swept through Iowa
item.description: Iowa's Department of Public Safety says there could be many more people injured. Other severe weather events, such as floods and snowstorms, are expected in other parts of the country.
item.content:encoded:
Iowa's Department of Public Safety says there could be many more people injured. Other severe weather events, such as floods and snowstorms, are expected in other parts of the country.

(Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
